style.name: Lindy Hop
style.description: The original swing dance, born in Harlem in the late 1920s. Characterized by its swingout, improvisation, and connection to jazz music.

moves.name: Rock Step
moves.description: The foundational weight shift - stepping back and returning. The starting point of most Lindy Hop patterns.

moves.name: Triple Step
moves.description: Three steps in two beats (step-ball-change). Creates the syncopated, bouncy feel of swing.

moves.name: Pulse
moves.description: The continuous bouncing that maintains connection to music and partner. The engine of Lindy Hop.

moves.name: Connection
moves.description: Physical and energetic link between partners through frame and hand holds.

moves.name: Frame
moves.description: The structure of arms and body that allows partners to communicate movement intentions.

moves.name: Closed Position
moves.description: Partners facing each other in embrace. Starting position for many patterns.

moves.name: Open Position
moves.description: Partners connected by hands with space between. Allows individual expression.

moves.name: 6-Count Basic
moves.description: Step-step-triple-step-triple-step. Foundation for 6-count moves.

moves.name: 8-Count Basic
moves.description: Step-step-triple-step-step-step-triple-step. Foundation for swingouts.

moves.name: Basic Charleston
moves.description: Solo Charleston footwork - kick forward, step back, kick back, step forward. Historical root of Lindy Hop.

moves.name: Jazz Walk
moves.description: Stylized walking with attitude, bent knees, and rhythmic emphasis. Foundation of solo movement.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: Continuous vertical pulse in the body, fundamental to swing rhythm when dancing solo.

moves.name: Swingout from Closed
moves.description: THE defining move of Lindy Hop. Partners rotate around each other from closed to open position.

moves.name: Savoy Swingout
moves.description: Original Harlem style swingout with circular path and grounded movement.

moves.name: Hollywood Swingout
moves.description: West coast variation with more linear slot movement, influenced by film choreography.

moves.name: Swingout from Open
moves.description: Swingout starting from open position. Partners come together then open again.

moves.name: Lindy Circle
moves.description: Partners rotate together in closed position without opening up.

moves.name: Send Out
moves.description: Leader sends follower away to establish open position and distance.

moves.name: Tuck Turn
moves.description: 6-count turn where leader creates compression before redirecting follower into a spin.

moves.name: Pass By
moves.description: Partners pass each other, changing places. Simple but versatile 6-count pattern.

moves.name: Underarm Turn
moves.description: Follower turns under leader's raised arm while passing.

moves.name: Bring In
moves.description: Leader brings follower from open position back to closed position.

moves.name: Side-by-Side Charleston
moves.description: Partners stand next to each other doing Charleston kicks together.

moves.name: Hand-to-Hand Charleston
moves.description: Partners face each other doing Charleston, connected by both hands.

moves.name: Jockey Position
moves.description: Compact closed position for Charleston, useful on crowded floors.

moves.name: Boogie Forward
moves.description: Weight shifts forward with attitude. Building block for Shim Sham.

moves.name: Boogie Back
moves.description: Weight shifts backward with attitude. Paired with boogie forward.

moves.name: Boogie Drop
moves.description: Boogie with a lowering motion, adding dynamics to the basic boogie.

moves.name: Kick Ball Change
moves.description: Syncopated footwork - kick, step on ball, change weight. Very versatile.

moves.name: Strut
moves.description: Stylized walking with extended legs and attitude. Classic jazz movement.

moves.name: Texas Tommy
moves.description: Swingout where leader passes follower's hand behind her back. Historic move from 1910s.

moves.name: Inside Turn
moves.description: Follower turns toward leader during swingout. Most common swingout variation.

moves.name: Outside Turn
moves.description: Follower turns away from leader during swingout.

moves.name: Free Spin
moves.description: Follower spins without hand connection, relying on momentum.

moves.name: Swingout with Kick
moves.description: Swingout with decorative kicks added to the footwork.

moves.name: Swingout with Double Kick
moves.description: Swingout with two kicks, typically on 7-8 or 1-2.

moves.name: Syncopated Swingout
moves.description: Swingout with delayed timing - follower holds on 1, comes in fast on 2.

moves.name: Reverse Swingout
moves.description: Swingout with follower moving counter-clockwise around leader.

moves.name: Half Swingout
moves.description: Follower stays on one side of leader, combining normal and reverse.

moves.name: Swingout in Place
moves.description: Swingout executed without traveling, staying in closed position area.

moves.name: Swingout with Tap Behind
moves.description: Swingout incorporating a tap step behind the body.

moves.name: Tandem Charleston
moves.description: Both partners face same direction doing Charleston. Must-know for all Lindy Hoppers.

moves.name: Charleston Tuck Turn
moves.description: Tuck turn from Charleston rhythm. Transitions between Charleston variations.

moves.name: Tandem Push Out
moves.description: From tandem Charleston, leader pushes follower out to open position.

moves.name: Charleston Cross Kicks
moves.description: Charleston with crossing leg action, adding visual interest.

moves.name: Hand-to-Hand Cross Kicks
moves.description: Cross kicks done in hand-to-hand position.

moves.name: Skip Up
moves.description: Quick kicking Charleston variation with upward energy.

moves.name: Skip Up with Flare
moves.description: Skip up with added arm or leg flair.

moves.name: Long Skip Up
moves.description: Extended version of skip up covering more distance.

moves.name: Flip Flops
moves.description: Charleston variation with alternating kick direction.

moves.name: Skip Up Flip Flops
moves.description: Combination of skip up and flip flop movements.

moves.name: Tandem Kick Variations
moves.description: Various kick patterns done while in tandem position.

moves.name: Sugar Push
moves.description: Compression-based move where partners push and rebound.

moves.name: Basket Whip
moves.description: Double hand hold where lead moves around follow.

moves.name: Cuddle Position
moves.description: Wrapped position with follower's back to leader.

moves.name: Promenade Position
moves.description: Partners side by side, both facing same direction.

moves.name: Pecks
moves.description: Quick pecking motion often done from closed position.

moves.name: Pecks with Spin
moves.description: Pecks move with added follower spin.

moves.name: Frankie 6s
moves.description: Syncopated 6-count variations attributed to Frankie Manning.

moves.name: Swivels
moves.description: Follower pivots on balls of feet, rotating hips. Classic styling for swingouts.

moves.name: Switches
moves.description: Quick directional changes in swivels. Advanced styling.

moves.name: Swivel Walks
moves.description: Walking with swivel action on each step.

moves.name: Shorty George
moves.description: Bent knees walking with attitude, named after Shorty George Snowden.

moves.name: Suzie Q
moves.description: Heel-toe twisting motion. Featured in Big Apple routine.

moves.name: Truckin'
moves.description: Walking with index finger wagging and hips swaying.

moves.name: Apple Jacks
moves.description: Jazz step with heel-toe action, developed in 1940s.

moves.name: Tacky Annie
moves.description: Originally a tap step, now classic jazz movement.

moves.name: Camel Walk
moves.description: Stylized walk imitating camel movement. Classic vernacular jazz.

moves.name: Camel Walk Backward
moves.description: Camel walk executed moving backward.

moves.name: Fishtail
moves.description: Side-to-side movement imitating a fish's tail.

moves.name: Snake Hips
moves.description: Undulating hip movement creating snake-like motion.

moves.name: Body Roll
moves.description: Wave-like movement rolling through the body.

moves.name: Break-a-Leg
moves.description: Dramatic leg break movement, often used as accent.

moves.name: Shout
moves.description: Energetic movement often done in Big Apple calls.

moves.name: Box Step
moves.description: Basic jazz box pattern used as foundation.

moves.name: Grapevine
moves.description: Side-stepping pattern crossing feet alternately.

moves.name: Crazy Legs
moves.description: Loose, rubber-legged movement.

moves.name: Eagle Slide
moves.description: Sliding movement with arms extended.

moves.name: Scissor Kicks
moves.description: Alternating front kicks crossing at the knees.

moves.name: Stomp Off
moves.description: Stomping exit from Shim Sham routine.

moves.name: Push and Cross Over
moves.description: Shim Sham movement with push and crossing action.

moves.name: Half Break
moves.description: Tap-derived break step used in jazz routines.

moves.name: Texas Tommy Reverse
moves.description: Texas Tommy with reversed hand position or direction.

moves.name: Hammerlock
moves.description: Follower's arm wrapped behind their back in held position.

moves.name: Double Inside Turn
moves.description: Two inside turns in one swingout.

moves.name: Double Outside Turn
moves.description: Two outside turns in one swingout.

moves.name: Double Turn
moves.description: Two full rotations in a single turn. Requires spotting and balance.

moves.name: Triple Turn
moves.description: Three full rotations. Advanced spinning technique.

moves.name: Tandem Turn
moves.description: Partners rotate 360 together while in tandem.

moves.name: Tandem Rainbow
moves.description: Follower led in arc over leader's head from tandem.

moves.name: Loop-de-Loops
moves.description: Chained inside turns, follower continuously rotates.

moves.name: Sliding Doors
moves.description: Partners pass each other repeatedly in quick succession.

moves.name: Revolving Doors
moves.description: Variation on sliding doors with rotation.

moves.name: Trebuchet Sendout
moves.description: Dramatic sendout with rotational momentum.

moves.name: Cross-Body Sendout
moves.description: Sendout going across the leader's body.

moves.name: Cross-Body Inside Turn Sendout
moves.description: Cross-body sendout with inside turn.

moves.name: Toss Across
moves.description: Quick toss of follower across to other side.

moves.name: Minnie Dip
moves.description: Playful small dip, named after Minnie the Moocher.

moves.name: Dip
moves.description: Full dip where follower leans back supported by leader.

moves.name: Drop
moves.description: Controlled lowering of follower toward floor.

moves.name: Airplane Charleston
moves.description: Partner lifted/leaned with arms extended like wings.

moves.name: Basic Aerial
moves.description: Simple lift where follower leaves ground briefly.

moves.name: Side Car
moves.description: Aerial where follower is lifted to leader's side.

moves.name: Kip
moves.description: Springing aerial movement.

moves.name: Frankie Throw
moves.description: Classic aerial named after Frankie Manning.

moves.name: Stop on 5
moves.description: Musical accent stopping movement on count 5.

moves.name: Swingout Kate
moves.description: Reverse half swingout taught by Frankie Manning.

moves.name: Liquid
moves.description: Smooth flowing movement between positions.

moves.name: Lift and Slide
moves.description: Fancy footwork combining lift and sliding motion.

moves.name: Cross and Lunge
moves.description: Crossing step into a lunge position.

moves.name: Foot Sweep
moves.description: Sweeping the foot along the floor decoratively.

moves.name: Double Foot Sweep
moves.description: Two consecutive foot sweeps.

moves.name: Kick Away
moves.description: Stylized kick facing away from partner.

moves.name: Shim Sham
moves.description: Classic jazz line dance routine. Lindy Hop tradition at social events.

moves.name: Big Apple
moves.description: Circle dance where caller shouts out jazz moves. Historical social dance.

moves.name: Tranky Doo
moves.description: Jazz line dance choreographed by Frankie Manning.

moves.name: California Routine
moves.description: Famous partnered routine from Hellzapoppin' by Frankie Manning.

moves.name: Jitterbug Stroll
moves.description: Modern jazz line dance by Ryan Francois.

moves.name: First Stops
moves.description: Early Savoy Ballroom ensemble routine.

moves.name: Fall Off the Log
moves.description: Stumbling motion as if falling off a log. Featured in Tranky Doo.

moves.name: Extreme Fall Off the Log
moves.description: Exaggerated version with bigger movement.

moves.name: Peckin
moves.description: Chicken-like head bobbing movement.

moves.name: Spank the Baby
moves.description: Slapping motion jazz step.

moves.name: Gaze Afar
moves.description: Looking into distance with stylized movement.

moves.name: Rusty Dusty
moves.description: Brushing off movement, jazz styling.

moves.name: Knee Slaps
moves.description: Slapping the knees rhythmically.

moves.name: Freeze
moves.description: Sudden stop in movement for musical accent.

moves.name: Jump Charleston
moves.description: Charleston with added jumping action.

moves.name: Squat Charleston
moves.description: Charleston executed in a low squat position.

moves.name: Kansas City Charleston
moves.description: Regional Charleston variation with distinct style.

moves.name: Savoy Kicks
moves.description: Kick style associated with Savoy Ballroom dancers.

moves.name: Johnny's Drop
moves.description: Dramatic drop movement named after a dancer.

moves.name: Heel Rock
moves.description: Rocking on the heels as footwork substitution.

moves.name: Ba Dum
moves.description: Rhythmic step variation for musical accent.

moves.name: Flying Home
moves.description: Step named after the famous Lionel Hampton song.

moves.name: Grinds
moves.description: Circular hip grinding movement.

moves.name: Crossovers
moves.description: Stepping across the body repeatedly.
